summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 10004, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Thirty-first Avenue South in the City of Seattle, from Day Street to Massachusetts Street, by grading and sidewalking the same, in accordance with Resolution of the City Council of the City of Seattle No. 672, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
